title: Data Destructuring
description:
Use destructuring to extract and transform data from complex objects.

## Requirements

Given the `apiResponse` object, use destructuring to:

1. Extract `userName` from `response.data.user.name`
2. Extract `userEmail` from `response.data.user.email`
3. Extract `posts` array from `response.data.posts` (default to empty array)
4. Extract `statusCode` from `response.status`
5. Create `postTitles` - an array of just the post titles using destructuring in a map

## Input Data

```javascript
const apiResponse = {
    status: 200,
    data: {
        user: {
            name: 'Alice',
            email: 'alice@example.com',
            role: 'admin'
        },
        posts: [
            { id: 1, title: 'Hello World', likes: 10 },
            { id: 2, title: 'JavaScript Tips', likes: 25 }
        ]
    }
};
```

## Expected Results

- `userName` = 'Alice'
- `userEmail` = 'alice@example.com'
- `posts` = array with 2 posts
- `statusCode` = 200
- `postTitles` = ['Hello World', 'JavaScript Tips']
hints: Use nested destructuring: const { data: { user: { name: userName } } } = obj
Rename while destructuring with colon: { name: userName }
In map, destructure the parameter: posts.map(({ title }) => title)
You can do it all in one destructuring statement or multiple
